title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Hi, I've seen a few other Alienware Topics here so I hope it is ok?

I have an Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P board which, once turned on, shows no signs of life, no fans, CPU and GPU are both cold, chipset does turn on and warm up as it should.

After around 20 to 30 or so seconds the alien head power button turns on with a solid red led. It did light up some alien lights only once when I first tested it but not anymore.

I have been unable to get the correct schematic for this LA-C912P board, however the power circuit on previous model LA-B753P is very similar so I have been getting by so far.
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ETL3b2ZBRwC4uHk0IwFnCJj-Hap5TDwV/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Does anyone here have the LA-C912P schematic?

The main power supplies, 19V, 5V on PL102 and 3.3V on PL101 are present.

PU300:
pin1, does not have 3V
pin7, 5V is present
pin10, has 4.59V

U18:
pin1, 3VALW is present
pin2, 3VALW is present
pin3, 0.7mV
pin4, 5VALW is present
pin13,14, no output

So the BIOS UH4 is not getting it's 3V_PCH even after pressing the power button.

The other Winbond chips are getting 3.3V on UT2, UE2, UT5, these three Winbond chips ARE NOT ON THE LA-B753P board nor the schematic I've provided.

There does not seem to be any chips getting hot at all.

What should I be checking next? Thanks

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Here is the schematic...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1N38pU9JxPgSlnVJC4wqgcYCqs1c4Ld47[/url]

So missing PCH_PWR_EN, which is controlled by KBC.
You must check power on signals required by KBC first; pins 33, 67, 111, 37, 65, 110, 115, 100, 106, 114.
Trigger ON/OFFBTN# and check for drop pulse at PBTN_OUT#.

KBC firmware is possible; do you have specific programmer?

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Thanks for the schematic.

UE5:
pin33, 3.3V
pin67, 3.3V
pin111, 3.28V
pn37, 3.3V
pin65, 11mV
pin110, 3.25V
pin115, 0.0V when off, 3.3V when powered on
pin100, 0.5mV
pin106, 0.6mV
pin114, 3.3V

Hopefully I got them correctly after double checking.

 Edit* PBTN_OUT# I did not notice any change when pressing power button.

I have a CH341A programer available to me.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Looks like KBC issue.
You need specific programmer, like Svod, Vertyanov, or RT809H.

You need to know where the programming KBC pins go to keyboard connector.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages

The seller sent me a link to a forum for the software download however, Windows defender is detecting it as "trojan:Win32/Occamy.C".

Link to forum here: [URL]https://ascnb1.ru/forma1/viewtopic.php?f=70&t=89694&start=0[/URL]

Do you have the software for it that's not potentually infected? :)

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Usually BIOS programmers are detected by the antivurs.
However, I don't remember to had some issue with mine.
I have old Vertyanov model, without keyboard lines multiplexer, not sure if software good for your's.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Are they the signals from post #3?

Only the intel chipset lightly warms up, then about 30 seconds or so later the power light goes from nothing to solid red. They are the only two reactions it does.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: Yes, check again what I've mentioned there...

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Please, do not quote an entire post visible few centimeters above.

Pin 115/KBC should have 3V before pressing power button.
If not, desolder UH5 and try to start again.

Pin 114 must drop to 0V when power button is pressed.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Pin 115 has 3V before and after powering on.

Pin 114 has 3V before and after powering on, so it does NOT drop to 0V after pressing the power button, if I hold the power button down then it drops to 0V only while holding it down.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Correct, it must drop ONLY when the button is pressed.
And other reactions must be checked at same time.

You can try new KBC, just in case.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: Voltage on PCH_DPWROK, PCH_BATLOW# and PM_SLP_SUS#?

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
PCH_DPWROK - 3.32V
PCH_BATLOW# - not sure where to test this one.
PM_SLP_SUS# - 0.418V

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Check voltage on PCH_RTCRST# and PCH_SRTCRST#.
Use component placement diagram to find and measure voltage on RH515, RH83 and RH84.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.badcaps.net/forum/showpost.php?p=987679&postcount=5[/URL]

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Awesome, I never knew there were board views for Alienware boards, thanks. :)
RH515 - 3.3V
RH83   - 3.033V
RH84   - 3.019V

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Let's check some basic things for KBC again.
Post levels at pins 67, 124, 125, 37, 100, 106, 107, 110, 115.
Also check AC_PRESENT and +3V_PCH_DSW.

Trigger ON/OFFBTN# and check for drop pulse at PBTN_OUT# at same time.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: I'm not sure of the exact power sequence requirements but I think at this point PM_SLP_SUS# should be coming up. What's the resistance to ground on this line?

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Voltage tests done after power button press.

Pin 67  - 3.3V
Pin 124 - 3.32V
Pin 125 - 3.3V
Pin 37  - 3.3V
Pin 100 - 0.6mV
Pin 106 - 6.0mV
Pin 107 - 0.6mV
Pin 110 - 3.2V
Pin 115 - 3.3V

+3V_PCH_DSW - 3.3V
AC_PRESENT  - 3.3V

No change at PBTN_OUT# pin 106 when ON/OFFBTN# in triggered

PM_SLP_SUS# - 8.26Mohm to ground

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Looks like KBC problem, but PCH can also impede it to work correctly.
KBC should send out PCH_PWR_EN, to generate +3VALW_PCH; check diode mode there.
Be sure to have good solders at KBC.
Check for broken traces, or moved components.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: EC may be waiting for PM_SLP_SUS# to come up. Power sequence isn't clear on that. And of course it's handled by EC firmware so hard to know what it's doing.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Power on diagram (page 56) is very ambiguous.
Is not clear the dependance between PCH_PWR_EN and SLP_SUS#.
Both appear on the same level, without any preference.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: Hmm... this is a tricky one, the PCH does still get warm when turned on from power button so the PCH is turning on???

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: There is no +5VALW on U18

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Is +3VALW present before pressing power button? +1VALW is never present right?
What's the resistance to ground on +3VALW?

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
Yes, +3VALW is present before and after power button, 13 ohms to ground, measured from cap CM11. 
+1VALW is never present, measured from JP2.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: 13 ohms to ground on +3VALW is too low. I'd guess it's caused by the PCH.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message:
You didn't post such a low resistamce for +3VALW before.
Could be PCH, but still a chance to be other chip connected there.

You can try removing chips (leaving PCH at the end), one by one.
KBC should be good, as you was able to read/write it.

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: If PCH is warming up with only +3VALW present, and +3VALW is 13 ohms to ground, I'm pretty sure the PCH itself is partially shorted somehow, and it would also explain why PM_SLP_SUS# doesn't come up. In my opinion next step would be replacing the PCH (if you have a BGA rework station).

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: Once PCH removed, check again the resistance there...

title: Alienware 17 R3 LA-C912P missing voltages
message: Unfortunatly I don't have a BGA rework station available to me.
